Job Title: Lead Business Analyst

Location: Atlanta, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Overview

Job Purpose

ICE Data Analytics, LLC (a subsidiary of Intercontinental Exchange, Inc.) is looking for a Lead Business Analyst to be part of the technology organization based in our Atlanta office. The Lead Business Analyst will collaborate with cross-functional ICE Data Analytics Products, Engineering, Data Operations, Quantitative and QA teams to perform analysis for development of tools and reports as they relate to the Fixed Income Analytics in order to achieve key management objectives. The Lead Business Analyst analyzes users' business needs for to develop effective and creative solutions within time constraints using but not limited to SQL, Visio and Programming technologies. Further, the Lead Business Analyst will manage all phases of the project life-cycle including providing input to parts of technical specs and developing requirements, design, test plans and production release artifacts.

Responsibilities

Prior experience in business analysis and worked as a liaison between Business and Technology teams as part of the SDLC processExperience working within an integrated technology environment – using relational databases, end-points/APIs and UIs to read and analyze data. Comfortable with documenting business and system requirements including documentation of comprehensive use-cases and working within iterative software development environment. Most importantly, being an integral part of the technology organizationElicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for business processes from usersCapture and document current business workflow and recommend improvements and efficienciesServe as a subject matter expect for development regarding evaluation workflow and understanding of fixed income and equity securitiesProduction support of legacy and new tools to troubleshoot issues and answer user questionsFormulate testing strategies and assist users and developers in testing of key deliverablesTrain and mentor all levels of business analystsReviews technical specs of business analysts on the team

Knowledge And Experience

Master’s degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Mathematics, Finance, Business Administration (M.B.A), or a related discipline preferred or equivalent experience6 years of experience in managing financials for the security master and related data - such as Reference Data, Market Data etc. - familiarity with system architecture, data flow and work flow supporting the security master (recommended)Experience in maintaining data, defining operational processes, and partnering across departmentsExperience working with product managers and developers to gather, document, present requirements and create workflows to support product development and data content enhancementExcellent knowledge of bond data - US Corporates (Investment Grade and High Yield), Global Bonds, Mortgage Backed Securities, Treasury Bonds etc.Strong knowledge of bond math to perform advanced Fixed Income calculations; extreme accuracy with numerical calculations (recommended)Strong knowledge of MS products including Visio, Excel, Word and PowerPointStrong SQL skills and knowledge of a programming language such as C++, R, Python, Visual Basic, PL/SQLStrong analytical and problem-solving capabilitiesGeneral technical background required (understanding of principals and key practices in the areas of application programming, database and system design)

Schedule

This role offers work from home flexibility of up to 2 days per week.

Intercontinental Exchange, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or ancestry, age, disability or veteran status, or other protected status.

Experience Level (if available): None
